result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Mancl

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David L Mancl in court.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for David L Mancl. 
Defendant requests a Jury Trial, Court grants. Bond is continued. This matter will be set for Trial.

11:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant David L Mancl not in court. Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for David L Mancl.  Attorney Grubofski states his client provided photos that he tested positive for Covid and wishes to reschedule.  If he doesn't show on the 5/13 a warrant will be issued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:29 AM Defendant David L Mancl in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Nathan T. Oswald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty. Bond is continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing notice mailed to new address on this date.

ADDRESS INFO for David L Mancl
Current: 911 1st Street South, Port Edwards, WI 54469 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2022)
Prior: 6281 Grant Road, Vesper, WI 54489

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:29 AM Defendant David L Mancl in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $250

01:30 PM Defendant David L Mancl appears in court, in custody. Attorney Andrew Slaven appears in court. David Knaapen appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears by video means. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter.
Absolute sobriety.   No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
